   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(erl_expand_records_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %%-define(debug, true).
   24: 
   25: -ifdef(debug).
   26: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   27: -define(config(X,Y), foo).
   28: -define(privdir, "erl_expand_records_SUITE_priv").
   29: -define(t, test_server).
   30: -else.
   31: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   32: -define(privdir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)).
   33: -endif.
   34: 
   35: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   36: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   37: 	 init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   38: 
   39: -export([attributes/1, expr/1, guard/1,
   40:          init/1, pattern/1, strict/1, update/1,
   41: 	 otp_5915/1, otp_7931/1, otp_5990/1,
   42: 	 otp_7078/1, pr_7873/1, maps/1,
   43:          side_effects/1]).
   44: 
   45: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   46:     Config.
   47: 
   48: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   49:     ok.
   50: 
   51: suite() ->
   52:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   53:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   54: 
   55: all() -> 
   56:     [attributes, expr, guard, init,
   57:      pattern, strict, update, maps,
   58:      side_effects, {group, tickets}].
   59: 
   60: groups() -> 
   61:     [{tickets, [],
   62:       [otp_5915, otp_7931, otp_5990, otp_7078, pr_7873]}].
   63: 
   64: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   68:     ok.
   69: 
   70: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   71:     Config.
   72: 
   73: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   74:     Config.
   75: 
   76: 
   77: %% Import module and functions.
   78: attributes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   79:     Ts = [
   80: 	  <<"-import(lists, [append/2, reverse/1]).
   81: 
   82:          -record(r, {a,b}).
   83: 
   84: t() ->
   85:     [2,1] = reverse(append([1],[2])),
   86:     3 = length([1,2,3]),
   87:     3 = record_info(size, r),
   88:     [a, b] = record_info(fields, r),
   89:     [_|_] = erl_expand_records_SUITE:all(),
   90:     ok.
   91: ">>
   92:       ],
   93:     run(Config, Ts),
   94:     ok.
   95:     
   96: %% Some expressions.
   97: expr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   98:     Ts = [
   99:       <<"
  100:          -record(r, {a,b,c}).
  101: 
  102:          t() ->
  103:              [1,2] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  104:                                R#r.a < 3],
  105:              [1,2] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  106:                                begin R#r.a < 3 end],
  107:              [1,2,3] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  108:                                  begin is_record(R, r) end],
  109:              [1,2,3] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  110:                                  begin erlang:is_record(R, r) end],
  111:              ok.
  112:       ">>,
  113:       <<"
  114:          -record(r, {a,b,c}).
  115: 
  116:          f(X) -> X.
  117: 
  118:          t() ->
  119:              A = {$c, 1, 3.14, a, \"hi\", [], [a,b]},
  120:              R = #r{a = element(6, A), b = #r.b},
  121:              3 = R#r.b,
  122:              <<1:8>> = <<(begin erlang:element(2, A) end):8>>,
  123:              self() ! {a, message, []},
  124:              One = 1 = fun f/1(1),
  125:              2 = fun(X) -> X end(One + One),
  126:              3 = fun exprec_test:f/1(3),
  127:              4 = exprec_test:f(4),
  128:              5 = f(5),
  129:              L = receive 
  130:                      {a,message,L0} ->
  131:                          L0
  132:                  end,
  133:              case catch a:foo(bar) of
  134:                  {'EXIT', _} -> ok
  135:              end,
  136:              _ = receive 			%Suppress warning.
  137:                     noop ->
  138:                        1/(length(L) - 0)
  139:                  after 0 ->
  140:                     ok
  141:                  end,
  142:              if 
  143:                  R#r.c =:= undefined ->
  144:                      ok;
  145:                  true ->
  146:                      not_ok
  147:              end.
  148: 
  149:          is_record(_, _, _) ->
  150:              error(wrong_is_record).
  151:       ">>,
  152:       <<"
  153:          -record(foo, {bar = [Bar || Bar <- ?MODULE:id([]), size(Bar) > 0]}).
  154: 
  155:          t() ->
  156:              {'EXIT',{{bad_filter,{foo,[]}},[_|_]}} = catch gh6501a(whatever),
  157:              [whatever] = gh6501b(whatever),
  158:              ok.
  159: 
  160:          gh6501a(Bar) ->
  161:              [Bar || #foo{}].
  162: 
  163:          gh6501b(Bar) ->
  164:              [Bar || is_tuple(#foo{})].
  165: 
  166:          id(I) -> I.
  167:       ">>
  168:       ],
  169: 
  170:     %% The code above should run equally well with and without
  171:     %% strict record tests.
  172:     run(Config, Ts, [no_strict_record_tests]),
  173:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  174:     
  175:     ok.
  176:     
  177: %% is_record in guards.
  178: guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  179:     File = filename("guard.erl", Config),
  180:     Beam = filename("guard.beam", Config),
  181:     Test = <<"-module(guard).
  182: 
  183:               -export([t/1]).
  184: 
  185:               -record(r, {a,b}).
  186: 
  187:               t(_) when is_record(3, r) ->
  188:                   1;
  189:               t(_) when is_record(a, r) ->
  190:                   2;
  191:               t(_) when is_record(3.14, r) ->
  192:                   3;
  193:               t(_) when is_record([], r) ->
  194:                   4;
  195:               t(_) when is_record([a], r) ->
  196:                   5;
  197:               t(_) when is_record($a, r) ->
  198:                   6;
  199:               t(_) when is_record(\"foo\", r) ->
  200:                   7;
  201:               t(_) when is_record(#r.a, r) ->
  202:                   8;
  203:               t(_) when is_record(<<\"foo\">>, r) -> % line 23
  204:                   9;
  205:               t(_) when is_record(1 + 2, r) ->
  206:                   10;
  207:               t(_) when is_record(+ 3, r) ->
  208:                   11;
  209:               t(_) ->
  210:                   12.
  211:              ">>,
  212: 
  213:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
  214:     {ok, guard, Ws} = compile:file(File, [return,{outdir,?privdir}]),
  215:     Warnings = [L || {_File,WL} <- Ws, {L,sys_core_fold,{nomatch,guard}} <- WL],
  216:     [{7,15}, {9,15}, {11,15}, {13,15}, {15,15}, {17,15},
  217:      {19,15}, {21,15}, {23,15}, {25,15}, {27,15}] = Warnings,
  218: 
  219:     ok = file:delete(File),
  220:     ok = file:delete(Beam),
  221:     ok.
  222: 
  223: %% Wildcard initialisation.
  224: init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  225:     Ts = [
  226:       <<"
  227:          -record(r, {a,b,c,d = foo}).
  228: 
  229:          t() ->
  230:              R = #r{_ = init, b = b},
  231:              #r{c = init, b = b, a = init} = R,
  232:              case R of
  233:                  #r{b = b, _ = init} -> ok;
  234:                  _ -> not_ok
  235:              end.
  236:       ">>
  237:       ],
  238:     run(Config, Ts),
  239:     ok.
  240:     
  241: %% Some patterns.
  242: pattern(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  243:     Ts = [
  244:       <<"-import(lists, [append/2, reverse/1]).
  245: 
  246:          -record(r, {a,b}).
  247: 
  248:          t() ->
  249:              1 = t(#r{}),
  250:              2 = t($a),
  251:              3 = t(1000),
  252:              4 = t({1000}),
  253:              5 = t(3),
  254:              6 = t(-3.14),
  255:              7 = t({4.0}),
  256:              8 = t(3.14),
  257:              9 = t(\"str\"),
  258:              10 = t([]),
  259:              11 = t([a|b]),
  260:              12 = t(\"string\"),
  261:              13 = t({[]}),
  262:              14 = t({a,b}),
  263:              15 = t({{}}),
  264:              16 = t({tuple,tupel}),
  265:              17 = t(4),
  266:              18 = t(10),
  267:              19 = t({a}),
  268:              20 = t(<<100:8,220:8>>),
  269:              21 = t(#r{a = #r{}}),
  270:              22 = t(2),
  271:              23 = t(#r{a = #r{}, b = b}),
  272:              24 = t(abc),
  273:              ok.
  274: 
  275:          t(abc) ->
  276:              24;
  277:          t($a) ->
  278:              2;
  279:          t(3) ->
  280:              5;
  281:          t(3.14) ->
  282:              8;
  283:          t(\"str\") ->
  284:              9;
  285:          t([]) ->
  286:              10;
  287:          t([a|b]) ->
  288:              11;
  289:          t(L) when is_list(L) ->
  290:              12;
  291:          t({L}) when list(L) ->
  292:              13;
  293:          t({a,b}) ->
  294:              14;
  295:          t({T}) when is_tuple(T) ->
  296:              15;
  297:          t(+ 4) ->
  298:              17;
  299:          t(3+7) ->
  300:              18;
  301:          t(<<A:8, (100+120):8>>) when A =:= 100 ->
  302:              20;
  303:          t(#r{a = #r{}, b = undefined}) ->
  304:              21;
  305:          t(#r.a) ->
  306:              22;
  307:          t(A) when is_record(A, r), record(element(2, A), r) ->
  308:              23;
  309:          t(A) when is_record(A, r) ->
  310:              1;
  311:          t(I) when is_integer(I) ->
  312:              3;
  313:          t({I}) when integer(I) ->
  314:              4;
  315:          t({F}) when float(F) ->
  316:              7;
  317:          t({A} = B) when A < B ->
  318:              19;
  319:          t(F) when is_float(F) ->
  320:              6;
  321:          t(T) when tuple(T) ->
  322:              16.
  323:       ">>
  324:       ],
  325:     run(Config, Ts),
  326:     ok.
  327:     
  328: strict(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  329:     Ts1 = [
  330:       <<"-record(r1, {a,b}).
  331:          -record(r2, {a,b}).
  332: 
  333:          t() ->
  334:              A = #r1{a = 1, b = 2},
  335:              ok = try 
  336:                       {1, 2} = {A#r2.a, A#r2.b},
  337:                       not_ok
  338:                   catch error:{badrecord,{r1,1,2}} -> ok
  339:                   end,
  340:              try
  341:                  case foo of
  342:                      _ when A#r2.a =:= 1 -> not_ok
  343:                  end
  344:              catch error:_ -> ok
  345:              end.
  346:          element(_, _) ->
  347:              error(wrong_element).
  348:       ">>
  349:       ],
  350:     run(Config, Ts1, [strict_record_tests]),
  351: 
  352:     Ts2 = [
  353:       <<"-record(r1, {a,b}).
  354:          -record(r2, {a,b}).
  355: 
  356:          t() ->
  357:              A = #r1{a = 1, b = 2},
  358:              {1, 2} = {A#r2.a, A#r2.b},
  359:              case foo of
  360:                  _ when A#r2.a =:= 1 -> ok
  361:              end.
  362:          element(_, _) ->
  363:              error(wrong_element).
  364:       ">>
  365:       ],
  366:     run(Config, Ts2, [no_strict_record_tests]),
  367:     ok.
  368:     
  369: %% Record updates.
  370: update(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  371:     Ts = [
  372:       <<"-record(r, {a,b,c,d,e,f}).
  373: 
  374:          t() ->
  375:              R0 = #r{},
  376:              R1 = R0#r{a = #r.a, e = {x,y}},
  377:              2 = R1#r.a,
  378:              R2 = R1#r{},
  379:              true = R1 =:= R2,
  380:              R3 = R2#r{c = fun(X) -> X end, 
  381:                        d = <<\"foo\">>, 
  382:                        e = [x,y,z], 
  383:                        f = {R0,R1}},
  384:              R4 = R3#r{a = R3#r{b = #r{}}},
  385:              true = erlang:is_record((R4#r.a)#r.b, r),
  386:              #r{a = R0, b = 3, c = 3.14, d = [], e = [[]], f = [{}]} = 
  387:                  R4#r{a = R0, b = 3, c = 3.14, d = [], e = [[]], f = [{}]},
  388:              ok.
  389: 
  390:          %% Just playing around a bit...
  391:          t1() ->
  392:              ((#r{a = (#r{b = #r{}})#r{a = #r{}}})#r{b = #r{}})#r{c = #r{}}.
  393: 
  394:          t2() ->
  395:              R0 = #r{},
  396:              #r{_ = R0#r{a = ok}}.
  397: 
  398:          %% Implicit calls to setelement/3 must go to the BIF,
  399:          %% not to this function.
  400:          setelement(_, _, _) ->
  401:              erlang:error(wrong_setelement_called).
  402:       ">>
  403:       ],
  404:     run(Config, Ts),
  405:     ok.
  406: 
  407: maps(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  408:     Ts = [<<"-record(rr, {a,b,c}).
  409:              t() ->
  410:                  R0 = id(#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3}),
  411:                  R1 = id(#rr{a=4,b=5,c=6}),
  412:                  [{R0,R1}] =
  413:                      maps:to_list(#{#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3} => #rr{a=4,b=5,c=6}}),
  414:                  #{#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3} := #rr{a=1,b=2,c=3}} =
  415:                      #{#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3} => R1}#{#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3} := R0},
  416:                  ok.
  417: 
  418:              id(X) -> X.
  419:             ">>],
  420:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  421:     ok.
  422: 
  423: %% Strict record tests in guards.
  424: otp_5915(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  425:     %% These tests are also run by the compiler's record_SUITE.
  426:     Ts = [
  427:       <<"-record(r, {a = 4,b}).
  428:          -record(r1, {a,b}).
  429:          -record(r2, {a = #r1{},b,c=length([1,2,3])}).
  430:          -record(r3, {a = fun(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}).
  431: 
  432:          t() ->
  433:              foo = fun(A) when A#r1.a > A#r1.b -> foo end(#r1{b = 2}),
  434:              0 = fun(A) when A#r2.a -> 0 end(#r2{a = true}),
  435:              1 = fun(A) when (#r1{a = A})#r1.a > 2 -> 1 end(3),
  436:              2 = fun(N) when ((#r2{a = #r{a = 4}, b = length([a,b,c])})#r2.a)#r.a > N ->
  437:                          2 end(2),
  438:              3 = fun(A) when (A#r2.a)#r1.a =:= 3 -> 3 end(#r2{a = #r1{a = 3}}),
  439:              ok = fun() ->
  440:                           F = fun(A) when record(A#r.a, r1) -> 4;
  441:                                  (A) when record(A#r1.a, r1) -> 5
  442:                               end,
  443:                           5 = F(#r1{a = #r1{}}),
  444:                           4 = F(#r{a = #r1{}}),
  445:                           ok
  446:                   end(),
  447:              3 = fun(A) when record(A#r1.a, r),
  448:                                    (A#r1.a)#r.a > 3 -> 3
  449:                  end(#r1{a = #r{a = 4}}),
  450:              7 = fun(A) when record(A#r3.a, r1) -> 7 end(#r3{}),
  451:              [#r1{a = 2,b = 1}] = 
  452:                  fun() ->
  453:                          [A || A <- [#r1{a = 1, b = 3}, 
  454:                                      #r2{a = 2,b = 1}, 
  455:                                      #r1{a = 2, b = 1}],
  456:                                A#r1.a > 
  457:                                    A#r1.b]
  458:                  end(),
  459:              {[_],b} = 
  460:                  fun(L) ->
  461:                          %% A is checked only once:
  462:                          R1 = [{A,B} || A <- L, A#r1.a, B <- L, A#r1.b],
  463:                          A = #r2{a = true},
  464:                          %% A is checked again:
  465:                          B = if A#r1.a -> a; true -> b end,
  466:                          {R1,B}
  467:                  end([#r1{a = true, b = true}]),
  468: 
  469:              p = fun(A) when (A#r1.a =:= 2) or (A#r2.a =:= 1) -> o;
  470:                     (_) -> p
  471:                  end(#r1{a = 2}),
  472: 
  473:              o = fun(A) when (A#r1.a =:= 2) orelse (A#r2.a =:= 1) -> o;
  474:                     (_) -> p
  475:                  end(#r1{a = 2}),
  476: 
  477:              3 = fun(A) when A#r1.a > 3, 
  478:                              record(A, r1) -> 3
  479:                  end(#r1{a = 5}),
  480: 
  481:              ok = fun() ->
  482:                           F = fun(A) when (A#r2.a =:= 1) orelse (A#r2.a) -> 2;
  483:                                  (A) when (A#r1.a =:= 1) orelse (A#r1.a) -> 1;
  484:                                  (A) when (A#r2.a =:= 2) andalso (A#r2.b) -> 3
  485:                               end,
  486:                           1 = F(#r1{a = 1}),
  487:                           2 = F(#r2{a = true}),
  488:                           3 = F(#r2{a = 2, b = true}),
  489:                           ok
  490:                   end(),
  491: 
  492:              b = fun(A) when false or not (A#r.a =:= 1) -> a;
  493:                     (_) -> b
  494:                  end(#r1{a = 1}),
  495:              b = fun(A) when not (A#r.a =:= 1) or false -> a;
  496:                     (_) -> b
  497:                  end(#r1{a = 1}),
  498: 
  499:              ok = fun() ->
  500:                           F = fun(A) when not (A#r.a =:= 1) -> yes;
  501:                                  (_) -> no
  502:                               end,
  503:                           no = F(#r1{a = 2}),
  504:                           yes = F(#r{a = 2}),
  505:                           no = F(#r{a = 1}),
  506:                           ok
  507:                   end(),
  508: 
  509:              a = fun(A) when record(A, r),
  510:                              A#r.a =:= 1,
  511:                              A#r.b =:= 2 ->a
  512:                  end(#r{a = 1, b = 2}),
  513:              a = fun(A) when erlang:is_record(A, r),
  514:                              A#r.a =:= 1,
  515:                              A#r.b =:= 2 -> a
  516:                  end(#r{a = 1, b = 2}),
  517:              a = fun(A) when is_record(A, r),
  518:                              A#r.a =:= 1,
  519:                              A#r.b =:= 2 -> a
  520:                  end(#r{a = 1, b = 2}),
  521: 
  522:              nop = fun(A) when (is_record(A, r1) and (A#r1.a > 3)) or (A#r2.a < 1) ->
  523:                            japp;
  524:                       (_) ->
  525:                            nop
  526:                    end(#r2{a = 0}),
  527:              nop = fun(A) when (A#r1.a > 3) or (A#r2.a < 1) -> japp;
  528:                       (_) ->
  529:                            nop
  530:                    end(#r2{a = 0}),
  531: 
  532:              ok = fun() ->
  533:                           F = fun(A) when (A#r1.a =:= 2) or (A#r2.a =:= 1) -> o;
  534:                                  (_) -> p
  535:                               end,
  536:                           p = F(#r2{a = 1}),
  537:                           p = F(#r1{a = 2}),
  538:                           ok
  539:                   end(),
  540: 
  541:              ok = fun() ->
  542:                           F = fun(A) when fail, A#r1.a; A#r1.a -> ab;
  543:                                  (_) -> bu
  544:                               end,
  545:                           ab = F(#r1{a = true}),
  546:                           bu = F(#r2{a = true}),
  547:                           ok
  548:                   end(),
  549: 
  550:              both = fun(A) when A#r.a, A#r.b -> both 
  551:                     end(#r{a = true, b = true}),
  552: 
  553:              ok = fun() ->
  554:                           F = fun(A, B) when ((A#r1.a) orelse (B#r2.a)) 
  555:                                              or (B#r2.b) or (A#r1.b) -> true;
  556:                                  (_, _) -> false
  557:                               end,
  558:                           true = F(#r1{a = false, b = false}, #r2{a = false, b = true}),
  559:                           false = F(#r1{a = true, b = true}, #r1{a = false, b = true}),
  560:                           ok
  561:                   end(),
  562: 
  563:              ok.
  564:       ">>
  565:       ],
  566:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  567:     ok.
  568: 
  569: %% Test optimization of record accesses and is_record/3 tests in guards.
  570: otp_7931(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  571:     Ts = [
  572:       <<"-record(r, {a = 4,b}).
  573:          -record(r1, {a,b}).
  574:          -record(r2, {a = #r1{},b,c=length([1,2,3])}).
  575:          -record(r3, {a = fun(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}).
  576: 
  577:          t() ->
  578:              ok = fun() ->
  579:                     F = fun(F, [H,H|T]) when is_record(H, r) ->
  580:                                 [H|F(F, T)];
  581:                              (F, [H|T]) when is_record(H, r) ->
  582:                                 [H|F(F, T)];
  583:                              (_, []) -> []
  584:                           end,
  585:                     [#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=1,b=42}] =
  586:                        F(F, [#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=1,b=42}]),
  587:                     {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(F, [#r1{}])),
  588:                     ok
  589:                   end(),
  590: 
  591:              true = fun() ->
  592:                       R = #r{},
  593:                       if is_record(R, r) -> true; true -> false end
  594:                      end(),
  595: 
  596:              ok = fun() ->
  597:                       F = fun(true, B) when B#r1.a -> ok;
  598:                              (false, _) -> error
  599:                       end,
  600:                       ok = F(true, #r1{a=true}),
  601:                       error = F(false, anything_goes),
  602:                       {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(true, #r1{})),
  603:                       {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(true, #r{})),
  604:                       ok
  605:                   end(),
  606: 
  607: 	     ok = fun() ->
  608: 		      F = fun([{a,R}=T]) when R#r.a =:= 42 ->
  609:                                    {ok,tuple_size(T)};
  610: 			     ([{a,R}=T]) when R#r1.a =:= 7 ->
  611:                                    {ok,tuple_size(T)};
  612: 			     (_) -> error
  613: 		          end,
  614: 		      {ok,2} = F([{a,#r{a=42}}]),
  615: 		      {ok,2} = F([{a,#r1{a=7}}]),
  616: 		      error = F([{a,#r1{}}]),
  617: 		      error = F({a,b,c}),
  618: 		      error = F([]),
  619: 		      ok
  620: 	     end(),
  621: 
  622: 	     ok = fun() ->
  623: 		      F = fun(X, Y, Z) when is_record(X, r1) andalso
  624:                                             (is_record(Y, r2) orelse
  625:                                              is_record(Z, r3)) -> true;
  626: 			     (_, _, _) -> false
  627: 		          end,
  628: 		      true = F(#r1{}, #r2{}, #r3{}),
  629:  		      true = F(#r1{}, #r2{}, blurf),
  630:  		      true = F(#r1{}, blurf, #r3{}),
  631:  		      false = F(#r1{}, blurf, blurf),
  632: 		      false = F(blurf, #r2{}, #r3{}),
  633:  		      false = F(blurf, #r2{}, blurf),
  634:  		      false = F(blurf, blurf, #r3{}),
  635:  		      false = F(blurf, blurf, blurf),
  636: 		      ok
  637: 	     end(),
  638: 
  639: 	     ok = fun() ->
  640: 		      F = fun(R=#r{a=42}) when R#r.b =:= 7 ->
  641:                                    {ok,R};
  642: 			     (_) -> error
  643: 		          end,
  644: 		      {ok,#r{a=42,b=7}} = F(#r{a=42,b=7}),
  645: 		      error = F(#r{}),
  646: 		      error = F([a,b,c]),
  647: 		      ok
  648: 	     end(),
  649: 
  650:              ok.
  651:       ">>
  652:       ],
  653:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  654:     ok.
  655: 
  656: %% OTP-5990. {erlang,is_record}.
  657: otp_5990(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  658:     Ts = [
  659:       <<"
  660:          -record(r, {a,b,c}).
  661: 
  662:          t() ->
  663:              [1,2,3] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  664:                                  begin {erlang,is_record}(R, r) end],
  665:              [1,2,3] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  666:                                  begin {erlang,is_record}(R, r) end],
  667:              ok.
  668:       ">>,
  669: 
  670:       <<"
  671:          -record('OrdSet', {orddata = {},
  672:                             ordtype = {}}).
  673: 
  674:          to_sets(S) when tuple(S#'OrdSet'.ordtype) ->
  675:              ok.
  676: 
  677:          lc(S) ->
  678:              [X || X <- [S], tuple(X#'OrdSet'.ordtype)].
  679: 
  680:          t() ->
  681:              S = #'OrdSet'{},
  682:              ok = to_sets(S),
  683:              [S] = lc(S),
  684:              ok.
  685:       ">>
  686:       ],
  687:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  688:     ok.
  689:         
  690: 
  691: %% OTP-7078. Record update: missing test.
  692: otp_7078(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  693:     Ts = [
  694:       <<"
  695:          -record(r, {f}).
  696:          -record(r2, {}).
  697: 
  698:          t() ->
  699:              {'EXIT',_} = (catch (#r2{})#r{}),
  700:              {'EXIT',_} = (catch (#r2{})#r{f = 2}),
  701:              ok.
  702:       ">>,
  703: 
  704:       <<"
  705:          -record(r, {f}).
  706: 
  707:          maker(F) -> 
  708:              put(a, get(a)+1),
  709:              #r{f = F}.
  710: 
  711:          t() ->
  712:              put(a, 0),
  713:              (maker(2))#r{},
  714:              1 = get(a),
  715:              ok.
  716:       ">>
  717: 
  718:       ],
  719:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  720:     ok.
  721: 
  722: %% PR-7873. Reserved words as record names.
  723: pr_7873(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  724:     Words = [
  725:              <<"after">>,
  726:              <<"begin">>,
  727:              <<"case">>,
  728:              <<"try">>,
  729:              <<"catch">>,
  730:              <<"end">>,
  731:              <<"fun">>,
  732:              <<"if">>,
  733:              <<"of">>,
  734:              <<"receive">>,
  735:              <<"when">>,
  736:              <<"maybe">>,
  737:              <<"else">>,
  738:              <<"andalso">>,
  739:              <<"orelse">>,
  740:              <<"bnot">>,
  741:              <<"not">>,
  742:              <<"div">>,
  743:              <<"rem">>,
  744:              <<"band">>,
  745:              <<"and">>,
  746:              <<"bor">>,
  747:              <<"bxor">>,
  748:              <<"bsl">>,
  749:              <<"bsr">>,
  750:              <<"or">>,
  751:              <<"xor">>
  752:           ],
  753: 
  754:     Code = <<"
  755:          -record('WORD', {a = 1}).
  756: 
  757:          -type x() :: #WORD{}.
  758: 
  759:          t() ->
  760:             'WORD' = element(1, #WORD{}),
  761:             2 = #WORD.a,
  762:             A = #WORD{},
  763:             _ = #WORD{a=5},
  764:             1 = A#WORD.a,
  765:             _ = A#WORD{},
  766:             C = A#WORD{a = 2},
  767:             2 = C#WORD.a,
  768:             #WORD{a = X} = C,
  769:             2 = X,
  770:             D = #WORD{a = 2}#WORD{a = 3},
  771:             4 = D#WORD{a = 4}#WORD.a,
  772:             3 = match1(D),
  773:             ok = match2(D, 3),
  774:             ok = match3(#WORD{a=#WORD{}}),
  775:             ok.
  776: 
  777:          -spec match1(x()) -> any().
  778:          match1(#WORD{a = X}) -> X.
  779: 
  780:          -spec match2(#WORD{}, any()) -> ok.
  781:          match2(Rec, V) when Rec#WORD.a == V -> ok.
  782: 
  783:          match3(#WORD{a=#WORD{}}) -> ok.
  784:       ">>,
  785:     F = fun(Word) ->
  786:                 binary:replace(Code, <<"WORD">>, Word, [global])
  787:         end,
  788:     Ts = lists:map(F, Words),
  789:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  790:     ok.
  791: 
  792: id(I) -> I.
  793: 
  794: -record(side_effects, {a,b,c}).
  795: 
  796: %% Make sure that the record expression is only evaluated once.
  797: side_effects(_Config) ->
  798:     init_counter(),
  799: 
  800:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,0},_}} = catch (id(bump_counter()))#side_effects{a=1},
  801:     1 = read_counter(),
  802: 
  803:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,1},_}} = catch (id(bump_counter()))#side_effects.b,
  804:     2 = read_counter(),
  805: 
  806:     ok.
  807: 
  808: init_counter() ->
  809:     put(counter, 0).
  810: 
  811: bump_counter() ->
  812:     put(counter, get(counter) + 1).
  813: 
  814: read_counter() ->
  815:     get(counter).
  816: 
  817: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  818: 
  819: run(Config, Tests) ->
  820:     run(Config, Tests, []).
  821: 
  822: run(Config, Tests, Opts) ->
  823:     F = fun(P) ->
  824:                 {SourceFile, Mod} = compile_file_mod(Config),
  825:                 _ = compile_file(Config, P, Opts),
  826:                 AbsFile = filename:rootname(SourceFile, ".erl"),
  827:                 code:purge(Mod),
  828:                 code:load_abs(AbsFile, Mod),
  829:                 case catch Mod:t() of
  830:                     {'EXIT', _Reason} = Error ->
  831:                         io:format("failed, got ~p~n", [Error]),
  832:                         fail();
  833:                     ok ->
  834:                         ok
  835:                 end
  836:         end,
  837:     lists:foreach(F, Tests).
  838: 
  839: %% Compiles a test module and returns the list of errors and warnings.
  840: 
  841: compile_file(Config, Test0, Opts0) ->
  842:     {File, _Mod} = compile_file_mod(Config),
  843:     Filename = 'exprec_test.erl',
  844:     Test = list_to_binary(["-module(exprec_test). "
  845:                            "-compile(export_all). ",
  846:                            Test0]),
  847:     File = filename(Filename, Config),
  848:     Opts = [export_all,return,{outdir,?privdir}|Opts0],
  849:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
  850:     {ok, _M, Ws} = compile:file(File, Opts),
  851:     warnings(File, Ws).
  852: 
  853: compile_file_mod(Config) ->
  854:     {filename('exprec_test.erl', Config), exprec_test}.
  855: 
  856: filename(Name, Config) when is_atom(Name) ->
  857:     filename(atom_to_list(Name), Config);
  858: filename(Name, Config) ->
  859:     filename:join(?privdir, Name).
  860: 
  861: warnings(File, Ws) ->
  862:     case lists:append([W || {F, W} <- Ws, F =:= File]) of
  863:         [] -> [];
  864:         L -> {warnings, L}
  865:     end.
  866: 
  867: fail() ->
  868:     ct:fail(failed).
